project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Quick fine grain scheduling is missing.  You can quickly assign a task to a release and set the priority, but often in large groups expected start and due dates are required.  This is still very cumbersome in Jira and GreenHopper
fields.summary: Once a task is scheduled to a release, the list view should allow finer scheduling of start and due date

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: I would like an optional fourth "In Testing" column on the task board.
fields.summary: Add a fourth column to the task board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: I would like to be able to configure GreenHopper (probably per context) to choose card colour based on the issue priority rather than on the issue type.
fields.summary: Assign card colour by issue priority

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Tested in GreenHopper 2.1.1 and 2.2, both with Jira 3.12.2.

1) Create a new workflow with one extra transition identical to that of close issue
* Copy the default workflow
* Add a transition "Accept Issue" to the "Resolved" step
** Destination step: Closed
** Transition view: Resolve Issue Screen
* Edit the post functions on the new transition
** Change the final function from fire generic event to fire issue closed event

2) Create a test project
* Assign this workflow to a workflow scheme and assign the workflow scheme to the new project
* Create a version in the new project

3) Create a new issue

4) In the planning board drag the issue into the version

5) On the task board drag the issue from the todo column to the done column
* When prompted say you want to resolve the issue, not close it
* Now change the fix resolution to Duplicate

6) Click 'Inner action' on the card and select close issue
* The status will change to closed and the fix resolution will stay at duplicate - GOOD

7) Repeat steps 3-6 but in step 6 select 'accept issue' instead of 'close issue'
* The status will change to closed and the fix resolution will be forced to Fixed: BAD!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

8) Repat steps 3-5. Now view the issue in the Issue Navigator and from there do 'Accept Issue'
* The status will change to closed and the fix resolution will stay at duplicate - GOOD

So, only when transitioning via GreenHopper is the issue resolution value overwritten to Fixed. Perhaps this is related to the fact that GreenHopper doesn't show the issue transition screen?

This is a blocker because the fix resolution cannot be changed once the ticket is closed!
fields.summary: Resolution overwritten on transition to status closed from custom workflow transition

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: We have a JIRA announcement banner which we use in our jira instance. This banner is NOT displayed, when any GreenHopper tab has been selected. The banner should also appear for GreenHopper tabs.
fields.summary: JIRA Annoucement Banner is NOT Displayed when Planning /Task Board Tab is selected

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: We found them easier to read when they were not italics.  It really isn't needed and we liked it as it was before.  If others prefer italics, maybe make it an option so we can turn it off.
fields.summary: Do not italicize the summary and description fields

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: I would like to be able to configure the number of lines used in the cards for multi line fields (ie summary, description)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The taskboard currently has 3 fixed swimlanes: TODO - IN PROGRESS - DONE. If the swimlanes on the taskboard could be configurable, the taskboard could completely reflect what we are currently doing on a whiteboard: pulling stickies from TODO --> REQUIREMENTS --> DEVELOPMENT --> TEST --> ACCEPTATION --> DONE.  This could support XP, Scrum, Kanban, etc planningboards in the most flexible way.

This would require configuration for the swimlanes as such and a flexible taskboard configuration page, taking all the configured swimlanes into account.
fields.summary: Configurable swimlanes

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: The portlet shows graphs based on the last selected context, which often distorts the meaning of the graphs.  If the portlet isn't always showing the default context (which I think it should) then at least the portlet should allow selecting a context so that we don't have to force people to leave the portlet to change the context to see the graphs in the portlet properly
fields.summary: Allow selecting the context from the Greenhopper Portlet

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Just always show in the bottom left corner the following for all types of cards (in list view, summary view etc).  Below are 3 examples - Showing the static text for "Assignee" and "Status" is unnecessary in these examples.  Maybe lead with the status since user names are often longer and it is better to have the name cut off than the status.

            Open - <unassigned>
            Fixed - Jim Jones 
            Closed - Sue Smith
fields.summary: Save card real-estate by combining status and assignee into 1 field w/o static text

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: The fields shown in the wonderful list view need to be able to be customized.  For example now it doesn't make a lot of sense for us to show the Fix Version field since we primarily use it in the planning board where that field is well know by all of the items you are looking at.
fields.summary: Allow the list view fields to be customized

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
It would be great if right from the list view we could do two things:
1) Change the summary of the item without opening a Jira IFrame
2) Open the Jira IFrame in Edit mode

Maybe via 2 pencils (one to the right of the Jira issue #) and 1 to the right of the summary
fields.summary: From List view, introduce the Pencil icon to edit the Jira issue as well as the summary

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi,
We just installed greenhopper into a jira enterprise installation.  We're seeing a couple configuration problems (not seeing options I'd expect to see in the configuration manager), but I'll start with one specific one in case that helps clarify other things...We added a GreenHopper Ranking custom field in JIRA, but we're not seeing it when we go to create a new issue.  It's configured as a global field, so I'd expect to see it.

Can you let me know what other info you need to help with this?  Thanks.
fields.summary: not seeing expected configuration options or fields during creation

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I can create the portlet on my JIRA dashboard.
Then following the Confluence 'Displaying a JIRA Portlet on your Confluence Page' (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/JIRA+Portlet+Macro) I try to place the portlet on my confluence page.
I get this error: The page you were trying to reach does not exist. You may want to try a search, or browse the site to find the page you were looking for.

The link I use for the portlet macro is correct, because I can I paste the link directly into the browser window, the portlet displays perfectly.
fields.summary: Portlet doesn't embedd into a confluence page.

When I tried to navigate to the current date the page would post without having selected a date.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Maybe I need to learn more about the tool but -- when I select multiple issues in the list view and drag them to a new version, any sub-tasks of those issues are left behind -- unlike moving a single task with sub-tasks, where I am prompted whether and which sub-tasks to move also. Based on that behavior, as well as how I think it "should" work, I'd expect in a multi-select move that I'd get the same prompt, with all sub-tasks of all selected issues available for selection and moving.
fields.summary: Sub-tasks should follow parent tasks in bulk move

fields.description:
This is really 3 bugs
1. Our JIRA change history is littered with what looks like changes to the Rank field when no change was made.  It happens for nearly every operation on an issue.  this happens even when there is no change to Rank.  This is confusing and just clutter.  See below for an example.
2.  The value displayed currently in the JIRA change log for rank is meaningless - e.g. there is no Rank 219000000
3.  When I do drag and drop rank an item, there is no change to the change history in JIRA for rank but the rank value does change ! :) 

Thanks for listening and helping.

-------------------
Change by Joel Feldman - 11/Feb/08 12:36 PM  
Fix Version/s   Sprint 20-Red [ 10020 ]  
Rank  2190000000   

Change by Joel Feldman - 11/Feb/08 01:22 PM  
Fix Version/s  Sprint 20-Red [ 10020 ]   
Rank  20000000 

Change by Chris Brookins - 19/Feb/08 07:28 PM  
Summary  78BL8Q ScheduleWizard: Clicking OK in Holidays form doesn't save the new business hours for the user  78BL8Q ScheduleWizard: Clicking OK in Holidays form doesn't save the new business hours for the user  
Rank  645000000
fields.summary: JIRA change history shows garbage values for GH Rank field even when Rank field is unchanged, and doesn't update change history when rank does change

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I am running GH 2.1.1 on JIRA 3.12.1 

- Rank an issue to the top of your planning board via drag and drop
- Verify it is at the top by clicking optimize
- Edit the issue and change any field like summary
- Save it
- click Optimize in the planning board

The GH rank field is blown away (e.g. this issue will now appear at the bottom of the ranking list) - this is 100% reproducable by us.
fields.summary: After editing any issue, and then clicking optimize, the greenhopper RANK field is blown away and the item goes to the bottom of the list

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Greenhoppers custom rank field is read-only in JIRA.  

It would be great if there was some renderer for that field in Jira, so while editing an issue in Jira, I could click a button next to the rank, and enter or select a different item to move the rank next to and also select if the item shoud be moved "before" or "after" the selected item.  

e.g. if my items and ranks were 

A with rank 1
B  with rank 2
C with rank 3

And I was editing Item A in JIRA, I could click a button see a dialog box, and select item C and indicate "after" and that would cause A to be moved after C in rank as follows.  

B  with rank 1
C with rank 2
A with rank 3
fields.summary: Allow changing greenhopper ranks in JIRA with a JIRA renderer

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Today I need to do this awkard process after selecting one or more issues to move across pages
1) drag them over a page number (which page number I should drag to is a guess since I can't see what I am dragging to)
2) after I drop on the page, watch the page number switch
3) find the issues at the bottom.  Or repeat steps #1-3 if I got the page # wrong.
4) select drag and drop them to the right spot on the page - if that spot on the page is off-screen I need to drop and then scroll my window and repeat step 4.

*Instead I'd prefer to do it in 1 drag step like MS Word allows for dragging text.* 
e.g. When I hover over a page number on a drag operation, switch to the target page BEFORE I drop, then I can drop exactly where I want.  Also when I drag items outside of the visible scrolling area of the page, the browser window should auto-scroll up / down depending on where my cursor is so I can drag and drop exactly where I want to.    This is just like what happens with MS Word and dragging some selected text.   As I drag outside the window, the window scrolls in the direction of my dragging.  And If I drag the text over a minimized window app in the task bar, the windows app opens to accept the text I am dragging so I can drop it there.  Greenhopper pages would operate like windows apps in this case, opening as I dragged over each page.

Another less elegant (but equally fast) option would be to have a modal "Move" button.  I select the items to Rank, click Move, and then find the page I want (by clicking on each page - no dragging), and then when found I click on the item that I want to move the items next to.  Like I said not as elegant, but faster and less error prone than how it is now :)
fields.summary: Simplify the process of ranking a large number of items across pages

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
While planning issues in the Planning Board, I wanted to edit the Context. I clicked the pen icon next to "Context: Default". I was not possible to click on anything in the popup. I closed the popup hovered my mouse above the pen icon, the Edit context tooltip appeared. I clicked again the icon but could not Edit my context.

If the popup can only be opened in View mode, the tooltip should not mention that we can Edit the context.
fields.summary: clarify the icon or tooltip for the Context menu

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Currently the greenhopper graphs show values on the graph that include 3 decimal places - this makes reading the values difficult.  I think 1 or even 0 decimal points would make reading the values much clearer w/o losing functionality.
fields.summary: Values displayed on graphs should have only 1 or 0 decimal points, not 3

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
This happens all the time when scrubbing issues.
Steps to reproduce:
1) Select a saved context 
2) Now you realize you want this context but slightly different (e.g. maybe change sort order, or change the filter) 
3) So you click Custom context, but the context you have previously selected is cleared.  I have to rebuild the entire context up from scratch, just to change it slightly.  

If you saved it then I could just click custom, make the 1 change, and then use it or optionally save it.  This would really simply the creation of new contexts and allow people to refine the context's easier.
fields.summary: Make it easier to create a new context when looking at a Saved context by not clearing the context when I click "Custom"

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When I have JIRA-admin rights -> after click to List - IE 6.0 is frozen and is not reponding. IE has to be closed then.

All subsequential clicks to Planning board (with same "crashed" project) leads to same situation.
With lower rights project works.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: By eliminating white space between lines, and reducing the vertical height of the individual items a person can view / drag and drop rank many more items on 1 page which is a real help to doing work.  I mocked up a "after" screenshot after taking a "before" screengrab of your Greenhopper.
fields.summary: Tighten up the list view's vertical spacing to maximize the # of items you can see in a vertical list on 1 page

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
See the attached screenshot.  The summary card GUI is not making the best use of the limited space on the card.    
- The summary is colored in light grey and way to short.  It is the most important data on the card.  It should be black and given 3 lines (it seems there is room) or at least the 2nd line shouldn't be cut off so early.
- The words "Assignee:" and "Status:" are bold and dark text.  But the actual statuses and assignee names are grey and barely readable.  The actual names and statuses are the most important data, not the field label :)  Please show the actual statuses and assignee names as black (or some standard color you use for all data like royal blue - anything but grey which is hard to read) and I'd remove the bolding from the words "Assignee:" and "Status:"  - the cleanest UI's do very little with coloring and bolding - only adding it in rare cases.  Frankly I'd vote that the labels are light grey and the statuses/names are black (not bold)
fields.summary: Touch up summary card GUI to make it more readable and useful - de-emphasize items not important.

fields.description:
I am doing drag and drop prioritizationin the Planning Board using Summaries. I am dragging Stories and Bugs. I know that I can not drag sub-tasks. I get unpredictable results when dragging within the page. I get even more unpredictable results when dragging to another page. I hover over the page number that I want to drop to but it shows up another random page. 

Also everytime I go back to the Planning Board prioritizations change on me. 

I am sorting by Rank. I have clicked on the "hand" to optimize. 

Also should a Story's sub-tasks always follow the Story (Feature) in this view? Sometimes they do and sometimes they don't. 

We have the latest Jira version: 

It feels basically broken to me. Am I missing something?
fields.summary: Drag and Drop prioriization has unpredictable results

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
On the default dashboard, the GreenHopper link shows up when I first log in on every project. Selecting this link on a project on which GreenHopper is not enabled simply takes you to the open issues tab. Now when you return to the dashboard the greenhopper link disappears from all projects, including the ones on which it is enabled. This is disconcerting as the link is inconsistent in how it appears.

Additionally, even though GreenHopper has only been enabled on a few projects, the planning board and task board links appear on the default dashboard. When selected, these links take me to a random project (I think the last one in alphabetical order, though I cant prove it). The behavior ought to be that if GreenHopper is not enabled, do not show these links on the default dashboard at all. Users can go into their project and then get into the planning board. That way users of projects in which GH is not enabled do not get confused by these links.
fields.summary: GreenHopper link shows up on projects on which GreenHopper is not enabled on the default dashboard

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The project list can be missing some projects since it is based on the browsable permission of the user.
JIRA admin might not have the rights to browse project and shouldnt prevent them from seeing these projects in this list.

The work around is to give jira-administrators the tight to browse the missing projects.
What also works, is adding jira-administrators to all project roles, which is essentially the same thing
Not very elegant but it will temporary fix it.
fields.summary: The project list in the GreenHopper general configuration is incomplete. (Based on permission?)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I really think we should consider this as suggested by a user.

{quote}
I think that the burn down on the custom field should behave the same
as for the hour burndown chart.  If I use story points, as I plan to, I
would like to see actual versus ideal (guideline) burndown for the story
points to help me estimate the release date.  Also, I think that all
burndown charts should show ideal (guideline) and actual average
velocity.  Have a history for velocity tells me how many story points or
hours my team can burn each day or week.  This really helps with
planning.{quote}
fields.summary: As a GH User I would like to see the Guide line and the average curves in my value based charts

fields.summary: The Protlet shows up even if you don't have the permissions.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Could be nice if we could multi select issues in a page drag them on an issue to rank.

the logic could be
-*IF* drag  --> #1, #3, #7, #9  on # 4-
-*THEN* -->  #7 #9 #4 #1 #3-

The logic will be:
# Regroup the selected issues sorted by rank
# Rank first issue on targeted issue
# Rank n Issue on Issue n-1

ie:
If selection is:
Issue #1
Issue #5
Issue #10

Targeted Issue: Issue #7

Result:
Issue #7
Issue #1
Issue #5
Issue #10
fields.summary: Support the multi-ranking within the page

fields.description: I have noticed peculiar behavior in the planning board.   When I have the version option view selected using the pull-down on the right, I see all the available versions along the right of the screen and a pull-down of all the same versions in the left upper border.  When I select a different version via the pull-down list on the left, the correct version gets highlighted along the right and screen updates properly.  Now, when I have the component view selected and I select a particular component along the right column, the view changes correctly and the upper left pull-down reflects the chosen component.  If I then select a different component from the left pull down, the selection then always changes to "Unknown" component and "Unknown" component  is highlighted along the right - no matter what component I select.  This behavior is very repeatable.
fields.summary: Drop down in the planning board behavior - Unscheduled -

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Situation:*
- Enter an Original Estimate
- Delete the original estimate

*Consequence*
The time remaining is augmented by the old original estimate in the charts.

*Cause:*
JIRA logs a change item (TIMEESTIMATE) for this transaction

*FIX:*
Ignore all change logs triggered by the ORIGINAL TIME ESTIMATE field
fields.summary: Deleting an Original Estimate doesn't reduce the remaining hours curve in the charts

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
* By default Unscheduled or Unknown are pinned and cannot be unpinned.
* The next one below is pinnable. Once pinned, the next one becomes pinnables and ...
* When unpinning, if there are some versions below that are pinned, they are also automatically unpinned.

Not sure about the following one but it seems to make sense
* A child can never be pinned. Therefore, changing master is disabled for a pinned version.

ALSO Explore:
The ability to drag-and-drop releases to (re)order them.
fields.summary: Allow to pin versions in the version board (also applies to components) (see details)
